intro: Cremastosperma longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed hookseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive hooked seed pods. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish flowers. The seeds are enclosed in long, curved pods that remain attached to the plant for an extended period.
